reviewText: Written and directed by Andy Dodd and produced by Phoenix Laine at Mangotree films well worth a view. A real feel good gem.

The movie is about Jessica, the new girl in school who meets Andrew, a shy 12 year old. Love blooms until the Falklands War intervenes.

I love the film, and itfs a great trip back to the 1980s and great memories for this '80s kid.

The costuming evokes memories of the period and the music helps set the mood greatly.

Well worth a purchaseif you like love stories, the 80s or just plain great movies.  Also supporting Indie filmmakers is also a great cause.

PS:  "Sorry, I donft like it" ~ Andrew  (Any 12 year old who likes a girl has said the wrong thing.  That was a true blue human laugh out loud moment, Andy.  Been there, done that.  Oy!
Wonderful story about 2 11year olds who fall in love, a lovely sweet movie, perfect for the whole family, great acting, these 2 kids are going to go far in their profession

Absolutely loved this film, even though i grew up in the 90's, the strong narrative of love and emotion through childhood make this film deep and a definite classic. The performances throughout were amazing, especially by the main children, and alongside the costumes and perfect script everything came together beautifully to create a film that will resonate with any audience! A must see! Good work Mangotree films!
A great film that makes you remember falling in love for the first time. As a child growing up in the 80s this film made me nostalgic for my childhood of crimped hair and leg warmers.
For those of us who grew up in the 80's this is a must see.  Fabulous short that brings tears to your eyes at the young love scenes that we all must remember.

One of the best family films ive seen. It made me howl with laughter cry with sadness and overjoyed at the finale. An absolute must for anyone who loves "feel good movies".well written and a superb cast worthy of any blockbuster status.

Remember being in grade school, navigating social relationships and finding that one person who you really gel with? That one person who you can have fun with? Who is also pretty darn cute? First crush/young love in all it's glory and pain, captured by Mr. Dodd, exquisitely in a short movie. Bravo.
